intro: Hunteria gracilis, commonly known as the slender hunteria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Hunteria gracilis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its unique floral structure and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
